body:
This should be a question of adding a new flag then using it as the default for `u.PartSize` instead of `s3manager.MinUploadPartSize` in [this bit of code](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/blob/master/backend/s3/s3.go#L1043).

Fancy having a go?

I supposed we have to used a flag in function "init()" of file s3.go : 
flags.VarP(&chunkSize, "s3-chunk-size", "", "Upload chunk size in MB.")

But before we need to declare a const "chunkSize".
And after in function "update" we have to used it : 
u.PartSize = chunkSize

May be something like that (or not) ? but I 'm not used to program in go, it would take me a lot of time to do it well :(

No worries!

I made an initial attempt here - let me know if it works for you!

https://beta.rclone.org/v1.40-040-gef58b6a5-s3-chunk-size/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

Thank you very much !
I tested it and it work as expected :)
For s3 users, we can now have better rate transfer (x2 for me).
It would be great to integrate it in the next stable release !
What setting are you using? I'd be interested in any experiments that you've run.

I used --s3-chunk-size=100M to transfer 2GB file : rclone copy source remote:/bucket  --s3-chunk-size=100M 
My network has low latency and good network bandwidth, with this use case, making too small chunks (5M) for transferring big file is not helping to have the bests performances.

without "--s3-chunk-size=100M" : 22MB/s
with "--s3-chunk-size=100M" : 43MB/s
Thanks for the update.  I've merged this now and updated the docs so it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org) from now on!

Just tested this beta functionality against a file size of 42GB and used various integer values (50M, 500M and 1000M) but the file is not getting transferred. Using this binary without this flag also causes the same file not getting transferred. However smaller file sizes are getting transferred properly. Please advice, thank you.
@EuropeanaDevelopment - when you say not getting transferred - how do you know?  What does the log say?  Can you try running with `-vv` and post the output?

```
# /usr/bin/rclone_beta -V
rclone v1.40-116-gbe8bd896β
- os/arch: linux/386
- go version: go1.10.1
```

```
# du -sh /backups/artifactory/20180331.020100.zip

```

@EuropeanaDevelopment - Oh I know what is happening.  It is calculating the sha1 checksum of the whole file which will take some time.  You can use the `--s3-disable-checksum` flag (you might have to get a new [beta](https://beta.rclone.org) for that) to disable.  You'll lose the ability to check the sha1sum of the upload if you do that though.

It works in conjuction with flag `--s3-disable-checksum` 

Thank you.
